titles.title: Of inquiry requesting the President to provide certain documents in his possession to the House of Representatives relating to the Environmental Protection Agency's April proposed finding that greenhouse gas emissions are a danger to public health and welfare.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 111-146.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 70.

bill.summary: 6/12/2009--Reported to House without amendment. Requests the President to furnish the House of Representatives all documents in his possession produced by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) or the Director of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) relating to the EPA's April proposed finding that greenhouse gas emissions are a danger to public health and welfare, including: (1) a specified untitled, undated memo; (2) any cost benefit or systematic risk analysis related to such proposed finding; and (3) scientific evidence that demonstrates health effects of greenhouse gases.
